title: UX polish: guided first entry flow, dashboard limit meter, and footer link cleanup

requirements.summary: Route Log empty-state action to Dashboard and auto-open the Add Entry dialog once after navigation.
acceptanceCriteria: When there are zero entries, clicking the empty-state button on /log routes the user to / (Dashboard).
After navigation from the Log empty state, the Add Entry dialog opens automatically without additional clicks.
The auto-open behavior triggers only once and does not keep re-opening on subsequent renders/navigation.
No changes are made to immutable hook files (e.g., frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts[x], frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).

file_operations.description: Update the empty-state primary action to navigate to the Dashboard with a one-time URL signal (e.g., a query param) that requests opening the Add Entry dialog.
Consume the one-time URL signal on initial render via a guarded effect to automatically open EntryFormDialog once, then clear the signal so it does not re-trigger on subsequent renders/navigation.
Add a small helper to read-and-clear a specific URL parameter (supporting hash/query scenarios already handled here) so the Dashboard can reliably consume the auto-open request exactly once.

requirements.summary: Add an accessible daily-limit usage indicator (progress/meter) on the Dashboard with a distinct over-limit state.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard shows a visual percent-used indicator for todayâ€™s caffeine intake relative to the daily limit.
The indicator has a clear over-limit style (e.g., destructive color treatment) when todayTotal > dailyLimit.
User-facing text remains in English and existing metrics (today total, daily limit, remaining) remain correct.

file_operations.description: Add a progress-style visual indicator (e.g., an HTML meter/progress with Tailwind styling) tied to the existing todayTotal/dailyLimit calculations; include accessible labeling (screen-reader text) and apply a visually distinct destructive treatment when over limit.

requirements.summary: Remove or disable footer social icon links that currently point to '#', preserving layout and accessibility.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer no longer contains anchor tags that navigate to "#" when clicked.
Footer remains visually consistent with the existing warm theme and layout.
No console errors or accessibility regressions are introduced by the footer change.

file_operations.description: Replace the placeholder footer social <a href="#"> icons with a non-clickable presentation (e.g., <span> or disabled <button type="button">) and ensure appropriate aria-label/aria-hidden usage while keeping spacing and visual balance consistent.
